title: Demonic gorilla/Strategies

properties.name: description
properties.value: Demonic gorillas are level 275 monsters that can be fought after the completion of Monkey Madness II. They are popular monsters as they drop zenyte shards, which are used to create the best jewellery in-game, and components for the ballistae. They're also classified as black demons on a Slayer task, which make them very appealing for players training Slayer.

content:
Demonic gorillas are level 275 monsters that can be fought after the completion of Monkey Madness II. They are popular monsters as they drop zenyte shards, which are used to create the best jewellery in-game, and components for the ballistae. They're also classified as black demons on a Slayer task, which make them very appealing for players training Slayer.

Contents

  • 1 Requirements
    • 1.1 Recommendations
  • 2 Getting there
  • 3 Mechanics
    • 3.1 Attack styles
    • 3.2 Attack style switching
    • 3.3 Prayer switching
  • 4 Tips
    • 4.1 Predicting their attack styles
    • 4.2 Item switches
    • 4.3 Special attack weapons
  • 5 Slayer task equipment
  • 6 Non-Slayer task equipment
  • 7 Duo strategy
    • 7.1 Strategy
  • 8 Equipment upgrades and downgrades

Requirements[edit | edit source]

  • Completion of Monkey Madness II to enter the Crash Site Cavern.

Recommendations[edit | edit source]

  • High combat stats. Although not required, see the skill levels below for an indication of the advised stats:
    • Level 80 or higher
    • Level 85 or higher
    • Level 80 or higher
    • Level 85 or higher
    • Level 80 or higher
    • Level 70 or higher
    • Level 70 or higher (for magic defence)
  • Completion of Recipe for Disaster for access to Barrows gloves.
  • Completion of Dragon Slayer II for access to the Ava's assembler.
    • Alternatively, completion of Animal Magnetism for access to the Ava's accumulator.
  • Completion of Shadow of the Storm for access to the arclight.
  • Having access to the imbued version of the Slayer helmet or black mask.

Getting there[edit | edit source]

The entrance to the Crash Site Cavern may be found north-west of the Grand Tree. Use the royal seed pod's teleport option and then run north-west, pass-through the opening in the fence and run north-east to enter the cave for the fastest travel option.

Mechanics[edit | edit source]

Demonic gorillas have a few unique mechanics that players should be aware of before fighting them.

Attack styles[edit | edit source]

Demonic gorillas use all three forms of combat, each one hitting up to 30 damage.

  • Magic attack: The gorilla rears up and dangles its forelegs, then emits a green orb from its mouth.
  • Melee attack: The gorilla swipes its claws downwards at the player.
  • Ranged attack: The gorilla uses its two front claws to grab a small boulder and throw it at the player.
  • Boulder toss: The gorilla tosses a boulder, which will appear above the player's position when it performed this attack. Players will take 33% of their health as damage if they don't move away from it. The boulder has an area of effect of 1x1. This ability is only used when the gorilla is using Ranged or Magic. The gorillas will not use this attack while using melee.

  • The Demonic gorilla's Magic attack.

  • The Demonic gorilla's Melee attack.

  • The Demonic gorilla's Ranged attack.

  • The Demonic gorilla's boulder toss attack, followed by a Magic attack.

Attack style switching[edit | edit source]

Demonic gorillas start with a random attack style, initiating combat as soon as they get within melee distance of a player or are struck from afar. They will switch attack styles after three missed hits, regardless if the player's protection prayer blocked them or not. However, the third attack must be prayed correctly against for the gorilla to consistently change its attack style:

  • If the third "missed" hit is not currently prayed against, the gorilla will either keep using the same attack style for the next 3 attacks or switch to another style. If the third "missed" hit was either a ranged or magic hit, however, the following attack will always be the same as the one just used, or a melee attack. For example: if you switch your prayer before getting hit a 0 by the third magic attack, the gorilla will keep using magic for the next 3 hits unless it starts walking towards you, indicating an incoming melee attack. Use this to avoid having to "guess" the next attack style after missing your prayer on the third ranged or magic hit.
  • If the third missed attack is prayed against, the gorilla will never use the same attack style for two cycles in a row.

The boulder toss does not count towards these "missed" hits.

While Melee-using gorillas can be safespotted, they will quickly change to another combat style if they cannot reach their target.

Prayer switching[edit | edit source]

When the gorilla spawns, it will stand idle for a brief second before pounding its chest, changing its protection prayer. They use all three protection prayers, but only one of them is active at any given time. The protection prayer gives them complete immunity towards attacks of that style, and it cannot be bypassed with a dragon scimitar or Verac's set.

The protection prayer lasts indefinitely, but the gorilla will change prayers whenever it takes 50+ damage in the style(s) it is not protecting against. This is in total damage, not damage from one combat style; for example, if a gorilla takes 49 melee damage but then is hit for 26 damage from Ranged, it will immediately use Protect from Missiles. This is usually only an advantage if the gorilla prays against Magic, since their Magic level and Defence bonuses are too high for Magic to hit them reasonably.

When the gorilla changes protection prayers, the player(s) attacking it will end combat, so it is important to change gear immediately and re-click on the gorilla to resume combat.

Tips[edit | edit source]

Predicting their attack styles[edit | edit source]

Although the demonic gorillas will switch their attack style to a randomly chosen attack style, there is a good method to predict their next attack style in 67% of the situations:

  • If the previous attack style was Melee: They will switch to either Magic or Ranged, there is no way to predict this.
  • If the previous attack style was Magic: They will switch to either Melee or Ranged. To predict this, move away from the gorilla:
    • If the demonic gorilla follows the player, it will attack with Melee next.
    • If the demonic gorilla stays on its tile, it will attack with Ranged next.
  • If the previous attack style was Ranged: They will switch to either Magic or Melee.
    • If the demonic gorilla follows the player, it will attack with Melee next.
    • If the demonic gorilla stays on its tile, it will attack with Magic next.

If an attack style switch is needed and the gorilla starts off the new attack pattern with a boulder, they will follow up with either Ranged or Magic attacks, so pray accordingly.

Item switches[edit | edit source]

Since the demonic gorillas change their protection prayers fairly often, it is advised not to bring too many item switches for your Melee and Ranged equipments. With fewer item switches, more focus can be used for switching your own offensive and protection prayers correctly, which means dealing more and taking less damage. For most players, an item switch for just the cape and the weapon slots will suffice.

It is highly recommended to use a convenient keybind (a.k.a. F-keys) for the prayer and inventory tabs, as this makes it easier to quickly switch between both interfaces.

Special attack weapons[edit | edit source]

Experienced players and players with high combat levels may not need any food while fighting gorillas, as the healing effect from the Saradomin godsword's special attack will restore enough Hitpoints. Some players may also bring Guthan's set in the event that the godsword fails to recover enough health or they take too much damage.

Typical melee special attack weapons, such as dragon claws and the dragon dagger, are not advised to use against demonic gorillas, since the subsequent hitsplats will be nulled if the gorilla ends up changing prayers in the process, as the prayer switching and landing hits will apply on different ticks. If you don't have a Saradomin godsword, simply use the toxic blowpipe's special attack, or just the arclight's if using a Twisted bow.

Slayer task equipment[edit | edit source]

See also: #Equipment upgrades and downgrades

This section shows a selection of set ups for players on a Slayer task. See the link above for more info on possible alternatives for each item slot.

Best-in-slot[edit | edit source]

The set up shown in this section currently costs approximately 1,831,443,903 coins.

Equipment[edit | edit source]

  • Slayer helmet (i) for increased damage output while on Slayer tasks.
  • Arclight for increased damage output against demon-type monsters.
  • A berserker ring (i) will boost the player's max hit with +3 when combined with an arclight.

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • Item switches for a Ranged attack style.
  • Divine potions for stat boosting.
  • Super restore potions for restoring prayer points.
  • Saradomin brew for overhealing Hitpoints before drinking a new dose of the divine potions.
  • Saradomin godsword for the best special attack weapon with its healing effect.
  • Royal seed pod for the quickest teleport.
  • Rune pouch for High Level Alchemy runes, as well as storing law rune drops.

More affordable option[edit | edit source]

The set up shown in this section currently costs approximately 10,287,243 coins.

Equipment[edit | edit source]

  • Slayer helmet (i) for increased damage output while on Slayer tasks.
  • Arclight for increased damage output against demon-type monsters.
  • A berserker ring (i) will boost the player's max hit with +3 when combined with an arclight.

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • Item switches for a Ranged attack style.
  • Divine potions for stat boosting.
  • Super restore potions for restoring prayer points.
  • Saradomin brew for overhealing Hitpoints before drinking a new dose of the divine potions.
  • Royal seed pod for the quickest teleport.
  • Rune pouch for High Level Alchemy runes, as well as storing law rune drops.

Budget option[edit | edit source]

The set up shown in this section currently costs approximately 5,667,822 coins.

Equipment[edit | edit source]

  • Slayer helmet (i) for increased damage output while on Slayer tasks.
  • Arclight for increased damage output against demon-type monsters.
  • A ring of dueling will teleport a player to clan wars or Ferox Enclave to bank and restore supplies and stats.

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • Item switches for a Ranged attack style.
    • Toxic blowpipe can also be used for its special attack weapon with its healing effect.
  • Potions for stat boosting.
  • Super restore potions for restoring prayer points.
  • A saradomin brew for extra Hitpoints restoration in case this is needed.
  • Royal seed pod for the quickest teleport.
  • Rune pouch for High Level Alchemy runes, as well as storing law rune drops.

Non-Slayer task equipment[edit | edit source]

See also: #Equipment upgrades and downgrades

This section show a selection of set ups for players without a Slayer task. See the link above for more info on possible alternatives for each item slot.

Best-in-slot[edit | edit source]

The set up shown in this section currently costs approximately 1,848,692,275 coins.

Equipment[edit | edit source]

  • Neitiznot faceguard for the helmet with the highest Strength bonus.
  • Arclight for increased damage output against demon-type monsters.
  • A berserker ring (i) will boost the player's max hit with +3 when combined with an arclight.

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • Item switches for a Ranged attack style.
  • Divine potions for stat boosting.
  • Super restore potions for restoring prayer points.
  • Saradomin brew for overhealing Hitpoints before drinking a new dose of the divine potions.
  • Saradomin godsword for the best special attack weapon with its healing effect.
  • Royal seed pod for the quickest teleport.
  • Rune pouch for High Level Alchemy runes, as well as storing law rune drops.

More affordable option[edit | edit source]

The set up shown in this section currently costs approximately 9,337,117 coins.

Equipment[edit | edit source]

  • Helm of neitiznot for an affordable helmet with high Strength bonus.
  • Arclight for increased damage output against demon-type monsters.
  • A berserker ring (i) will boost the player's max hit with +3 when combined with an arclight.

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • Item switches for a Ranged attack style.
  • Divine potions for stat boosting.
  • Super restore potions for restoring prayer points.
  • Saradomin brew for overhealing Hitpoints before drinking a new dose of the divine potions.
  • Royal seed pod for the quickest teleport.
  • Rune pouch for High Level Alchemy runes, as well as storing law rune drops.

Budget option[edit | edit source]

The set up shown in this section currently costs approximately 4,717,696 coins.

Equipment[edit | edit source]

  • Helm of neitiznot for an affordable helmet with high Strength bonus.
  • Arclight for increased damage output against demon-type monsters.
  • A ring of dueling will teleport a player to clan wars or Ferox Enclave to bank and restore supplies and stats.

Inventory[edit | edit source]

  • Item switches for a Ranged attack style.
    • Toxic blowpipe can also be used for its special attack weapon with its healing effect.
  • Potions for stat boosting.
  • Super restore potions for restoring prayer points.
  • A saradomin brew for extra Hitpoints restoration in case this is needed.
  • Royal seed pod for the quickest teleport.
  • Rune pouch for High Level Alchemy runes, as well as storing law rune drops.

Void Knight equipment[edit | edit source]

The set up shown in this section currently costs approximately 6,407,781 coins.

This set up ranks between the more affordable and budget options listed above in terms of damage output. However, the defensive stats are much lower.

Duo strategy[edit | edit source]

Since there is also a multicombat area with demonic gorillas, they can be fought against in a team. An effective method therefore is duo'ing with one player in full Dharok's equipment on 1 Hitpoint, while the other player is tanking the gorilla's attacks, as the player in the Dharok's equipment will have very high damage output.

With this duo strategy, one player starts attacking a demonic gorilla and, after the gorilla starts fighting back, the other will assist in the fighting. For the first player, it is advised to bring standard equipment, while for the other player it is advised to bring full Dharok's equipment for melee attacks, as the player doesn't have to worry about being attacked (if the strategy is done correctly by both players) and this equipment offers high damage output for Melee attacks.

Strategy[edit | edit source]

  • Make sure that the gorillas are never aggroed towards the player in full Dharok's while they are at 1 Hitpoints.
  • The tanking player can use a crossbow to lure gorillas from a distance, since running around might reset the aggression timers.
  • The tanking player should bring runes to cast the Boost Potion Share spell on the Lunar spellbook. Make sure both players have accept-aid enabled.
  • Don't bring too many item switches, as it will be difficult to keep up with them, since multiple players will deal damage.
  • Consider bringing a full Guthan's equipment to infinitely heal Hitpoints on the tanking account.
  • Try to time attacking the gorilla simultaneously with both accounts, to prevent attacking the gorilla while it just switched its protection prayer.

Equipment[edit | edit source]

Dharok's set attacker[edit | edit source]

The set up shown in this section currently costs approximately 40,412,980 coins.

Tank attacker[edit | edit source]

The set up shown in this section currently costs approximately 110,688,867 coins.

Equipment upgrades and downgrades[edit | edit source]

The sections listed earlier on this page display different possible equipment. However, there are many other equipment options, depending on the player's budget and available items. Therefore, the above listed equipment may be tweaked for each item slot. See the table below for a general overview of possible up- and downgrades for each item.

rawContent:
[[Demonic gorilla]]s are level 275 monsters that can be fought after the completion of [[Monkey Madness II]]. They are popular monsters as they drop [[zenyte shard]]s, which are used to create the best jewellery in-game, and components for the [[ballista]]e. They're also classified as [[black demon]]s on a [[Slayer task]], which make them very appealing for players training [[Slayer]].

==Requirements==
*Completion of {{SCP|Quests}} [[Monkey Madness II]] to enter the [[Crash Site Cavern]].

===Recommendations===
*High [[combat]] stats. Although not required, see the skill levels below for an indication of the advised stats:
**Level {{SCP|Attack|80}} or higher
**Level {{SCP|Strength|85}} or higher
**Level {{SCP|Defence|80}} or higher
**Level {{SCP|Ranged|85}} or higher
**Level {{SCP|Hitpoints|80}} or higher
**Level {{SCP|Prayer|70}} or higher
**Level {{SCP|Magic|70}} or higher (for magic defence)

*Completion of {{SCP|Quests}} [[Recipe for Disaster]] for access to [[Barrows gloves]].
*Completion of {{SCP|Quests}} [[Dragon Slayer II]] for access to the [[Ava's assembler]].
**Alternatively, completion of {{SCP|Quests}} [[Animal Magnetism]] for access to the [[Ava's accumulator]].
*Completion of {{SCP|Quests}} [[Shadow of the Storm]] for access to the [[arclight]].
*Having access to the imbued version of the [[Slayer helmet (i)|Slayer helmet]] or [[Black mask (i)|black mask]].

==Getting there==
The entrance to the [[Crash Site Cavern]] may be found north-west of the [[Grand Tree]]. Use the [[royal seed pod]]'s teleport option and then run north-west, pass-through the opening in the fence and run north-east to enter the cave for the fastest travel option.

==Mechanics==
[[Demonic gorilla]]s have a few unique mechanics that players should be aware of before fighting them.

===Attack styles===
Demonic gorillas use all three forms of [[combat]], each one hitting up to 30 damage.

*[[Magic]] attack: The gorilla rears up and dangles its forelegs, then emits a green orb from its mouth.
*[[Melee]] attack: The gorilla swipes its claws downwards at the player.
*[[Ranged]] attack: The gorilla uses its two front claws to grab a small boulder and throw it at the player.
*Boulder toss: The gorilla tosses a boulder, which will appear above the player's position when it performed this attack. Players will take 33% of their health as damage if they don't move away from it. The boulder has an area of effect of 1x1. This ability is only used when the gorilla is using Ranged or Magic. The gorillas will not use this attack while using melee.

Demonic gorilla - Magic attack.gif|The Demonic gorilla's Magic attack.
Demonic gorilla - Melee attack.gif|The Demonic gorilla's Melee attack.
Demonic gorilla - Ranged attack.gif|The Demonic gorilla's Ranged attack.
Demonic gorilla - Boulder attack.gif|The Demonic gorilla's boulder toss attack, followed by a Magic attack.
</gallery>

===Attack style switching===
Demonic gorillas start with a random attack style, initiating combat as soon as they get within melee distance of a player or are struck from afar. They will switch attack styles after three missed hits, regardless if the player's protection prayer blocked them or not. However, the third attack must be prayed correctly against for the gorilla to consistently change its attack style:

*If the third "missed" hit is not currently prayed against, the gorilla will either keep using the same attack style for the next 3 attacks or switch to another style. If the third "missed" hit was either a ranged or magic hit, however, the following attack will always be the same as the one just used, or a melee attack. For example: if you switch your prayer before getting hit a 0 by the third magic attack, the gorilla ''will'' keep using magic for the next 3 hits unless it starts walking towards you, indicating an incoming melee attack. Use this to avoid having to "guess" the next attack style after missing your prayer on the third ranged or magic hit.
*If the third missed attack is prayed against, the gorilla will never use the same attack style for two cycles in a row.

The boulder toss does not count towards these "missed" hits.

While Melee-using gorillas can be [[safespotted]], they will quickly change to another combat style if they cannot reach their target.

===Prayer switching===
When the gorilla spawns, it will stand idle for a brief second before pounding its chest, changing its protection prayer. They use all three protection prayers, but only one of them is active at any given time. The protection prayer gives them complete immunity towards attacks of that style, and it cannot be bypassed with a [[dragon scimitar]] or Verac's set.

The protection prayer lasts indefinitely, but the gorilla will change prayers whenever it takes 50+ damage in the style(s) it is not protecting against. This is in total damage, not damage from one combat style; for example, if a gorilla takes 49 melee damage but then is hit for 26 damage from Ranged, it will immediately use Protect from Missiles. This is usually only an advantage if the gorilla prays against Magic, since their Magic level and Defence bonuses are too high for Magic to hit them reasonably.

When the gorilla changes protection prayers, the player(s) attacking it will end combat, so it is important to change gear immediately and re-click on the gorilla to resume combat.

==Tips==
===Predicting their attack styles===
Although the demonic gorillas will switch their attack style to a randomly chosen attack style, there is a good method to predict their next attack style in 67% of the situations:
*If the previous attack style was Melee: They will switch to either Magic or Ranged, there is no way to predict this.
*If the previous attack style was Magic: They will switch to either Melee or Ranged. To predict this, move away from the gorilla:
**If the demonic gorilla follows the player, it will attack with Melee next.
**If the demonic gorilla stays on its tile, it will attack with Ranged next.
*If the previous attack style was Ranged: They will switch to either Magic or Melee.
**If the demonic gorilla follows the player, it will attack with Melee next.
**If the demonic gorilla stays on its tile, it will attack with Magic next.

If an attack style switch is needed and the gorilla starts off the new attack pattern with a boulder, they will follow up with either Ranged or Magic attacks, so pray accordingly.

===Item switches===
Since the demonic gorillas change their [[protection prayers]] fairly often, it is advised not to bring too many item switches for your [[Melee]] and [[Ranged]] equipments. With fewer item switches, more focus can be used for switching your own offensive and protection prayers correctly, which means dealing more and taking less damage. For most players, an item switch for just the cape and the weapon slots will suffice.

It is highly recommended to use a convenient [[Settings#Keybinds|keybind (a.k.a. F-keys)]] for the prayer and inventory tabs, as this makes it easier to quickly switch between both interfaces.

===Special attack weapons===
Experienced players and players with high combat levels may not need any food while fighting gorillas, as the healing effect from the [[Saradomin godsword]]'s special attack will restore enough Hitpoints. Some players may also bring Guthan's set in the event that the godsword fails to recover enough health or they take too much damage.

Typical melee special attack weapons, such as [[dragon claws]] and the [[dragon dagger]], are not advised to use against demonic gorillas, since the subsequent hitsplats will be nulled if the gorilla ends up changing prayers in the process, as the prayer switching and landing hits will apply on different ticks. If you don't have a [[Saradomin godsword]], simply use the [[toxic blowpipe]]'s special attack, or just the [[arclight]]'s if using a [[Twisted bow]].

====Equipment====
*[[Slayer helmet (i)]] for increased damage output while on Slayer tasks.
*[[Arclight]] for increased damage output against [[Demon (attribute)|demon-type monsters]].
*A [[berserker ring (i)]] will boost the player's max hit with +3 when combined with an arclight.

====Inventory====
*Item switches for a [[Ranged]] attack style.
*[[Divine potion]]s for stat boosting.
*[[Super restore]] potions for restoring prayer points.
*[[Saradomin brew]] for overhealing Hitpoints before drinking a new dose of the divine potions.
*[[Royal seed pod]] for the quickest teleport.
*[[Rune pouch]] for [[High Level Alchemy]] runes, as well as storing [[law rune]] drops.

==Duo strategy==
Since there is also a [[multicombat area]] with demonic gorillas, they can be fought against in a team. An effective method therefore is duo'ing with one player in [[Dharok the Wretched's equipment|full Dharok's equipment]] on 1 Hitpoint, while the other player is tanking the gorilla's attacks, as the player in the Dharok's equipment will have very high damage output.

With this duo strategy, one player starts attacking a demonic gorilla and, after the gorilla starts fighting back, the other will assist in the fighting. For the first player, it is advised to bring standard equipment, while for the other player it is advised to bring [[Dharok the Wretched's equipment|full Dharok's equipment]] for melee attacks, as the player doesn't have to worry about being attacked (if the strategy is done correctly by both players) and this equipment offers high damage output for Melee attacks.

===Strategy===
*Make sure that the gorillas are never aggroed towards the player in full Dharok's while they are at 1 Hitpoints.
*The tanking player can use a crossbow to lure gorillas from a distance, since running around might reset the aggression timers.
*The tanking player should bring runes to cast the [[Boost Potion Share]] spell on the [[Lunar spells|Lunar spellbook]]. Make sure both players have accept-aid enabled.
*Don't bring too many item switches, as it will be difficult to keep up with them, since multiple players will deal damage.
*Consider bringing a [[Guthan the Infested's equipment|full Guthan's equipment]] to infinitely heal Hitpoints on the tanking account.
*Try to time attacking the gorilla simultaneously with both accounts, to prevent attacking the gorilla while it just switched its protection prayer.
